info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued July 13 at 5:48PM MST until July 13 at 7:15PM MST by NWS Tucson AZ
info.description:
The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a
* Dust Storm Warning for... Western Cochise County in southeastern Arizona...
* Until 715 PM MST.
* At 548 PM MST, an area of blowing dust was located over Sierra Vista, moving southwest at 20 mph.
HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility.
SOURCE...Trained spotters reported.
IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel.
* Locations impacted include... Sierra Vista, Bisbee, Benson, Hereford, Whetstone, Huachuca City, St. David, Tombstone, Naco, Dragoon, Kartchner Caverns State Park, Fort Huachuca, Parker Canyon Lake, Palominas, Mescal, McNeal, Fairbank, Charleston, Ramsey Canyon Preserve and Texas Canyon.
This includes the following highways... Route 90 between mile markers 290 and 336. Route 80 between mile markers 293 and 359. Route 191 between mile markers 13 and 21. Route 92 between mile markers 322 and 355. Interstate 10 between mile markers 297 and 329. Route 82 between mile markers 46 and 67. Route 83 between mile markers 3 and 6.
info.instruction:
Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.

parameter.value: NWS: DUST STORM WARNING til 7:15 PM MST. Be ready for a sudden drop to zero visibility.

National Weather Service: DUST STORM WARNING for this area until 7:15 PM MST. Be ready for sudden drop to zero visibility. Pull Aside, Stay Alive! When visibility drops, pull far off the road and put your vehicle in park. Turn the lights off and keep your foot off the brake. Infants, the elderly and those with respiratory issues urged to take precautions.

parameter.value: SNM: AVISO DE TORMENTA DE POLVO hasta las 7:15 PM MST. Espere reduccion de visibilidad.

AVISO DE TORMENTA DE POLVO hasta las 7:15 PM MST. Estar alerta para una reduccion repentina en visibilidad. Cuando la visibilidad disminuya, mueva su vehiculo fuera de la carretera. Apague las luces y mantenga su pie fuera del freno. Se recomienda enfaticamente el tomar precauciones para los infantes, ancianos y personas con problemas respiratorios.
